York Entrepreneurs win national award

York Entrepreneur Society have won the 'Society Award' at the International Entrepreneurship Educators Conference in Edinburgh

York students record Viking voiceovers

York students have recorded voice-overs for an upcoming exhibition at the Jorvik Viking Centre in the city centre.

Sports funding 'critical' following YUSU budget cuts

Sports clubs have been told that "there just isn't the money" to replace essential kit or help them out of unforeseen financial difficulties next year.

Derwent Bar closure conceived 'two years ago' as part of University plan

The University has been planning a series of bar closures over the past two years, Nouse can reveal.

Save our porters

Reductions in the University's portering provision have provoked a strong and immediate backlash across campus.

University confirms free bus service to run between campuses

The University have today confirmed that they will be paying for a free bus service to transport people between the Heslington East and Heslington West campuses

Cyprus investigations extended at six month anniversary of chef's disappearance

The six month anniversary of York chef Claudia Lawrence's disappearance has provoked fresh appeals for help to find her.

University to enlarge campus car parks

The University has won its bid to enlarge car parking space on campus after questions had arisen about how an increase in car parking would impact the landscape

York shines again in Guardian award nominations

Students and publications from the University of York have once again shone in this years Guardian Student Media Awards, receiving nominations in a wide variety of categories

Student loans in 'chaos' due to huge influx of applications

Tens of thousands of students across the country are set to start the academic year with no funding from the Student Loans Company

Wiley to play Freshers' Ball

YUSU have today announced that Wiley will be headlining the Freshers Ball with his recent hit 'Wearing my Rolex'

York Student to run as Liberal Democrats candidate

A current York Student has been selected to run as the Liberal Democrat Candidate for the position of Councillor in the Wroxham ward of the Broadland District Council in Norfolk

Derwent Bar to remain open

YUSU and the University have announced that Derwent Bar will remain open from Tuesdays to Saturdays for the start of next term

Grenville defends University conduct in Derwent Bar closure

Pro-Vice Chancellor for Students Jane Grenville has defended the University's conduct prior to the recently-announced cut in Derwent Bar's opening hours.

Lack of Derwent Bar consultation slammed as YUSU plans to step in

Derwent Chair Joe Rankin describes the decision to close Derwent Bar "unexpected and extremely disappointing", as Lewis Bretts proposes a YUSU takeover of the venue

University announces closure of Derwent Bar

Derwent Bar looks set to close for much of the coming term following talks between YUSU and the University earlier this month. (Thumbnail credit Derwent bar. Photo: George Lowther)

York graduate inflicts latest defeat on Labour Party

University of York graduate Chloe Smith has been elected Conservative MP for Norwich North today, winning the seat from Labour and becoming the youngest MP in the country.

University announces road and building name changes

The University has announced the road and building name changes to be made due to Goodricke College moving to Heslington East

YUSU to reverse Welcome Week decision

YUSU have announced that they will be reversing the decision made last year to rebrand Freshers Week as Welcome Week

NUS attacks MP for "shameful" student finance decisions

The NUS has attacked David Lammy MP, Minister for Innovation, Universities and Skills, following a decision which they believe will leave poorer students short of funds.

Enquiry into bus passenger eliminated

An enquiry into the identity of a bus passenger who boarded a Coastliner bus at 5.39am on the morning of Claudia Lawrence's disappearance has been eliminated.

Gas works to disrupt University Road throughout September

Scheduled gas works to be carried out throughout York will cause disruption along University Road throughout September and possibly the start of October (Thumbnail credit Image from Google Streetview)

YUSU release new ruddy shelducks

Tuesday saw YUSU President Tom Scott fulfil last year's UGM motion to replace "Golden Duck" Trevor with a pair of ruddy shelducks. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: George Lowther)

"Being small maintains us as the best. The intention is not to get big, but sustainable"

Brian Cantor is confident. Confident in the University, its future, and his own leadership. And as he assuredly explains how York is set to go from strength to strength, it is hard not to agree.

JCRs face battle over legality of 'free' alcohol as YUSU and University issue final warning

Contention has arisen between JCRs and YUSU after it has emerged that colleges have been acting illegally by giving away free alcohol at events.

Woodstock success raises PS2,500

Last Saturday Vanbrugh Paradise was host to RAG's annual Woodstock event.

Economics department releases revised grades

The Economics Department has released revised marks for its Microeconomics 2 examination following strong student dissatisfaction with the marking procedure.

University welfare provision criticised

University officials have admitted that the welfare provision for students with eating disorders is inadequate.

YUSU to lobby University over altering term dates

YUSU has submitted a paper on students' behalf to the University calling for the current term dates to be altered.

Vanbrugh tops recycling charts

Leaked YUSU and Campus Services recycling figures have identified shortcomings by colleges in ensuring waste is recycled at an acceptable rate.
